tool.name: testflagger
tool.shortdescription: Refactored tool for manual and automated flagging
tool.description: The {\tt testflagger} tool performs manual as well as automatic synthesis flagging operations within casapy. The {\tt testflagger} tool can operate on one measurement set at a time.

method.name: testflagger
method.description: Create a {\tt testflagger} tool, and initializes some variables.

method.name: open
method.shortdescription: Opens the MS and attaches it to the tool.

param.name: msname
param.description: Measurement set to be processed. Default:

param.name: ntime
param.description: Time interval. If not given, the default will be used. Default:

method.name: selectdata
method.shortdescription: Selects the data based on the given parameters. For unspecified parameters, the full data range is assumed. All data selection parameters follow the ms-selection syntax.

param.name: config
param.description:
The record (dictionary) config may be given or not. If it is not given, 
 the whole MS will be selected. The record may contain any data selection parameters 
 supported by MSSelection such as
:

param.name: feed
param.description: \tFeed index or name : example : '1,2' (not supported yet)

param.name: uvrange
param.description: \tUV-distance range, with a unit : example : '2.0-3000.0 m'

param.name: time
param.description: \tTime range, as MJDs or date strings : example : 'xx.x.x.x.x~yy.y.y.y.y'

method.example:
Select the whole MS tf.selectdata()
Select a portion of the MS myrecord={} myrecord['scan']='1~3' myrecord['spw']='0:1~10' tf.selectdata(myrecord)
Another way to select a portion of the MS tf.selectdata(scan='3~5', spw='0')

method.name: parseagentparameters
method.shortdescription: Parses the parameters for the agent (flagging mode).
method.description: The specific data selection parameters for the agent (flagging mode) are parsed. These parameters are the data selection and mode-specific parameters. See the example below:

param.name: aparams
param.description:
It takes a record (dictionary) with the specific parameters for the flagging mode. 
 The record may contain any data selection parameters supported by MSSelection, as well as 
 mode-specific parameters such as:
 
 (1) array,feed,scan,field,spw,intent,correlation,antenna,uvrange,observation 
 (2) mode (which can be: manual,clip,quack,shadow,elevation,tfcrop,extendflags,unflag or summary) 
 For flagging mode=clip, the parameters are: expression, datacolumns, clipminmax, etc. 
 See the documentation of the task tflagger for all the available parameters for each mode.
 
 (3) apply: default is true (true for flagging and false for unflagging) 
 Example:

 myrecord={}
 myrecord['mode']='clip'
 myrecord['scan']='1~3'
 myrecord['clipminmax']=[0.02,0.3]
 myrecord['apply']=True
 tf.parseAgentParameters(myrecord)

method.example: myrecord={} myrecord['mode']='clip' myrecord['scan']='1~3' myrecord['clipminmax']=[0.02,0.3] myrecord['apply']=True tf.parseAgentParameters(myrecord)

method.name: init
method.description: This method will initialize the agents and create a list of agents. with their parameters. It takes no parameters.

param.name: sequential
param.description: Run the task in sequential or parallel mode

method.name: getflagversionlist
method.shortdescription: Print out a list of saved flag_versions.
method.description: Print out the list of flag versions in the MS, unless the parameter printflags=False. The list of names is returned.

method.name: printflagselection
method.shortdescription: Print out a list of current flag selections.
method.description: Print out a list of current flag selections.

method.name: saveflagversion
method.shortdescription: Save current flags with a version name.

method.name: restoreflagversion
method.shortdescription:
Restore flags from a saved flag_version. 
 versionname : name of flag version to restore to main table 
 merge : Type of operation to perform during restoration. 
 merge = replace : replaces the main table flags. 
 merge = and : logical AND with main table flags 
 merge = or : logical OR with main table flags 
 Default : replace.

method.name: parsemanualparameters
method.shortdescription: Parses data selection parameters and specific parameters for the manual mode.

param.name: feed
param.description: \tFeed index or name. Eexample: '1,2' (not supported yet)

param.name: uvrange
param.description: \tUV-distance range, with a unit. Example: '2.0-3000.0 m'

param.name: time
param.description: \tTime range, as MJDs or date strings. Example: 'xx.x.x.x.x~yy.y.y.y.y'

param.name: apply
param.description: \tParameter to flag or unflag the data. Default:

method.name: parseclipparameters
method.shortdescription: Parses data selection parameters and specific parameters for the clip mode.

param.name: feed
param.description: \tFeed index or name. Eexample: '1,2' (not supported yet)

param.name: uvrange
param.description: \tUV-distance range, with a unit. Example: '2.0-3000.0 m'

param.name: time
param.description: \tTime range, as MJDs or date strings. Example: 'xx.x.x.x.x~yy.y.y.y.y'

param.name: datacolumn
param.description: \tData column to use for clipping. Example: 'DATA'. Default:

param.name: clipoutside
param.description: Clip points outside this range? [True/False]. Default:

param.name: channelavg
param.description: \tAverage data over channels before clipping? [True/False]. Default:

param.name: apply
param.description: \tParameter to flag or unflag data. Default:

method.name: parsequackparameters
method.shortdescription: Parses data selection parameters and specific parameters for the quack mode.

param.name: feed
param.description: \tFeed index or name. Eexample: '1,2' (not supported yet)

param.name: uvrange
param.description: \tUV-distance range, with a unit. Example: '2.0-3000.0 m'

param.name: time
param.description: \tTime range, as MJDs or date strings. Example: 'xx.x.x.x.x~yy.y.y.y.y'

param.name: apply
param.description: \tParameter to flag or unflag the data. Default:

method.name: parseelevationparameters
method.shortdescription: Parses data selection parameters and specific parameters for the elevation mode.

param.name: feed
param.description: \tFeed index or name. Eexample: '1,2' (not supported yet)

param.name: uvrange
param.description: \tUV-distance range, with a unit. Example: '2.0-3000.0 m'

param.name: time
param.description: \tTime range, as MJDs or date strings. Example: 'xx.x.x.x.x~yy.y.y.y.y'

param.name: lowerlimit
param.description: The limiting elevation in degrees. Data obtained at lower antenna elevations will get flagged. Default:

param.name: upperlimit
param.description: The limiting elevation in degrees. Data obtained at higher antenna elevations will get flagged. Default:

param.name: apply
param.description: \tParameter to flag or unflag the data. Default:

method.name: parsetfcropparameters
method.shortdescription: Parses data selection parameters and specific parameters for the time and frequency mode.

param.name: feed
param.description: \tFeed index or name. Eexample: '1,2' (not supported yet)

param.name: uvrange
param.description: \tUV-distance range, with a unit. Example: '2.0-3000.0 m'

param.name: time
param.description: \tTime range, as MJDs or date strings. Example: 'xx.x.x.x.x~yy.y.y.y.y'

param.name: ntime
param.description: \tTime-range to use for each chunk (in seconds or minutes)

param.name: datacolumn
param.description: \tData column to use for clipping. Example: 'DATA'. Default:

param.name: timecutoff
param.description: Flagging thresholds in units of deviation from the fit. Default:

param.name: freqcutoff
param.description: Flagging thresholds in units of deviation from the fit. Default:

param.name: timefit
param.description: \tFitting function for the time direction (poly/line). Default:

param.name: freqfit
param.description: \tFitting function for the frequency direction (poly/line). Default:

param.name: maxnpieces
param.description: Number of pieces in the polynomial-fits (for \'freqfit\' or \'timefit\' = \'poly\'). Default:

param.name: flagdimension
param.description: Dimensions along which to calculate fits (freq/time/freqtime/timefreq). Default:

param.name: usewindowstats
param.description: Calculate additional flags using sliding window statistics (none,sum,std,both). Default:

param.name: halfwin
param.description: \tHalf-width of sliding window to use with \'usewindowstats\' (1,2,3). Default:

param.name: apply
param.description: \tParameter to flag or unflag the data. Default:

method.name: parseextendparameters
method.shortdescription: Parses data selection parameters and specific parameters for the extend mode.

param.name: feed
param.description: \tFeed index or name. Eexample: '1,2' (not supported yet)

param.name: uvrange
param.description: \tUV-distance range, with a unit. Example: '2.0-3000.0 m'

param.name: time
param.description: \tTime range, as MJDs or date strings. Example: 'xx.x.x.x.x~yy.y.y.y.y'

param.name: ntime
param.description: \tTime-range to use for each chunk (in seconds or minutes). Default:

param.name: extendpols
param.description: If any correlation is flagged, flag all correlations. Default:

param.name: growtime
param.description: \tFlag all \'ntime\' integrations if more than X% of the timerange is flagged (0-100). Default:

param.name: growfreq
param.description: \tFlag all selected channels if more than X% of the frequency range is flagged(0-100). Default:

param.name: growaround
param.description: Flag data based on surrounding flags. Default:

param.name: flagneartime
param.description: Flag one timestep before and after a flagged one. Default:

param.name: flagnearfreq
param.description: Flag one channel before and after a flagged one. Default:

param.name: apply
param.description: \tParameter to flag or unflag the data. Default:

method.name: parsesummaryparameters
method.shortdescription: Parses data selection parameters and specific parameters for the manual mode.

param.name: feed
param.description: \tFeed index or name. Eexample: '1,2' (not supported yet)

param.name: uvrange
param.description: \tUV-distance range, with a unit. Example: '2.0-3000.0 m'

param.name: time
param.description: \tTime range, as MJDs or date strings. Example: 'xx.x.x.x.x~yy.y.y.y.y'

param.name: spwchan
param.description: \tList the number of flags per spw and per channel. Default:

param.name: spwcorr
param.description: \tList the number of flags per spw and per correlation. Default:

param.name: basecnt
param.description: \tList the number of flags per baseline. Default:
